title: Par Sands Beach South West Coast Path Walk Route

images.title: Derek Harper / Par Sands
images.caption: Par Sands Looking along the sands from the South West Coast Path, with the China Clay harbour on the far side.

images.title: Pam Brophy / Par Sands
images.caption: A section of Par Sands at low tide.

images.title: Derek Harper / Cliffs near Little Hell
images.caption: Cliffs near Little Hell. Cliffs below Trill seen from the South West Coast Path. In the background are Par Sands and the china clay works.

images.title: Dean Howard / Beach near Par Sands
images.caption: Beach near Par Sands. Taken from the NT coastal footpath looking towards Little hell. A quite seculded beach just minutes away from Par sands.

images.title: Derek Harper / Lake, Par Beach
images.caption: Lake, Par Beach. The lake sits behind the dune system at Par Beach. Behind is housing on the A3082 (Polmear Road) and on Polmear Parc.

images.title: Tony Atkin / Road, Rail, Canal
images.caption: Road, Rail, Canal. Transportation links of various vintages running parallel towards the industrial waterfront at Par. This photograph was taken from a train on the main railway line crossing them all.

description: A circular walk around Par Sands Beach, near the little village of Par in Cornwall. The route uses part of the South West Coast Path and the Saints Way to visit Polkerris and Little Hell. You can start the walk from the large Par Sands car park. There's a wide beautiful beach with sand dunes, a lake and a freshwater tributary running along the far eastern side. You can extend the walk by picking up the Fowey to Polkerris Walk and visiting the beautiful Fowey.

details.subtitle: Pubs/Cafes
details.content: You can often see a coffee van at the beach during the warmer months.

details.subtitle: Dog Walking
details.content: The beach is very popular with dog owners so you will probably see other owners on your visit.

details.subtitle: Further Information and Other Local Ideas
details.content: Continue west along the coast path and you could visit the delightful Charlestown with its Georgian buildings, picturesque harbour and historic tall ships. It's a fine place for a stroll with excellent views over St Austell Bay and a splendid harbourside pub to visit.

display_address: Par Beach Car Park, Par Beach Trail, Polmear, Fowey, Cornwall, England, PL24 2AT, United Kingdom
